abstract: China is preparing to introduce bank deposit insurance as the first step in a wave of financial reforms. The country’s leaders believe a formal system of bank deposit insurance is needed as firms have increased lending and begun to offer increasingly risky investment products that do not appear on their balance sheets, Keith Bradsher reports in The New York Times.
